meanings.sent1: After the campfire died down, they decided to refire it for warmth.
meanings.sent2: The blacksmith had to refire the metal to make it malleable again.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally left the cookies in the oven too long, so he had to refire them.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to succeed was like refiring a dwindling flame.
meanings.sent5: The teacher had to refire the students' enthusiasm for the project with a fun activity.

meanings.sent1: She had to refire the kettle to make more tea for her guests.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic had to refire the engine to check for any issues.
meanings.sent3: The forgetful hiker had to refire his coffee after it went cold.
meanings.sent4: The sun refiring the earth with its morning rays.
meanings.sent5: The refiring of the oven brought warmth back to the kitchen.

meanings.sent1: The chef had to refire the steak to get it to the right temperature.
meanings.sent2: She had to refire the pizza because it was undercooked.
meanings.sent3: The refiring of the pasta made it even more delicious.
meanings.sent4: The refiring of the grill filled the air with a mouthwatering aroma.
meanings.sent5: Refiring the soup brought out its flavors even more.

meanings.sent1: He had to refire the damp wood to keep the campfire going.
meanings.sent2: The fireworks display had to be refired due to a technical glitch.
meanings.sent3: The refiring of the candle made the room glow warmly.
meanings.sent4: Her passion for music was refired after attending a concert.
meanings.sent5: Refiring the torch lit up the dark cave.
